Description: **Cloudflare zones** are assessed for **TLS 1.3** configuration by checking if it is enabled to benefit from **improved security** through simplified cipher suites and **faster handshakes** with zero round-trip time resumption.
Risk:
Without **TLS 1.3**, connections use older TLS versions with less secure characteristics.
- **Confidentiality**: legacy TLS versions have more complex cipher negotiations that may expose weaknesses
- **Integrity**: older protocols lack protection against downgrade attacks that TLS 1.3 provides
- **Performance**: slower handshakes impact user experience and increase latency

Code.Other:
1. Log in to the Cloudflare dashboard and select your account and domain
2. Go to SSL/TLS > Edge Certificates
3. Scroll to TLS 1.3
4. Toggle the setting to On
5. Verify that your clients support TLS 1.3 (all modern browsers do)

Recommendation.Text:
Enable **TLS 1.3** to provide the most secure and efficient TLS connections.
- All modern browsers support TLS 1.3 ensuring broad compatibility
- TLS 1.3 removes obsolete cryptographic algorithms
- Zero round-trip time (0-RTT) resumption improves performance
- Combine with minimum TLS version set to 1.2 or higher

Notes: TLS 1.3 is enabled by default on Cloudflare but should be verified. It provides security improvements and performance benefits through simplified handshakes.
